page.title: 07FORD AND WHARTON
page.content: Two settlements mentioned in {Domesday. At{Ford}is a small{single-naved {church with apse,}completely re-built in 1851, but certainly on Norman foundations. It was thought that the church was a{chapel of ease}for travellers using the ford, especially as the dedication is to St. John of Jerusalem, one of the patron saints of travellers. However, recently a Manpower Services Commission{archaeology survey established the remains of a{deserted {village}behind{Wharton Court,}just on the other side of the river from Ford. There is no trace of a church at Wharton, so it is possible that the villagers crossed the river at the ford to come to church.
